1.name: Shichinin no samurai
1.description: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.

2.name: Rear Window
2.description: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.

3.name: On the Waterfront
3.description: An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses.

4.name: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
4.description: A ship sent to investigate a wave of mysterious sinkings encounters the advanced submarine, the Nautilus, commanded by Captain Nemo.

5.name: A Star Is Born
5.description: A film star helps a young singer and actress find fame, even as age and alcoholism send his own career on a downward spiral.

6.name: Three Coins in the Fountain
6.description: Three American women working in Rome, Italy, share a spacious apartment and the desire to find love and marriage, each experiencing a few bumps in their journeys to romance.

7.name: Sabrina
7.description: A playboy becomes interested in the daughter of his family's chauffeur, but it's his more serious brother who would be the better man for her.

8.name: Dial M for Murder
8.description: A tennis player frames his neglected wife for murder after she inadvertently foils his plan to have her murdered.

9.name: Magnificent Obsession
9.description: A rich playboy whose recklessness inadvertently causes the death of a prominent doctor tries to make amends to his widow, and falls for her in the process.

10.name: Ulisse
10.description: A movie adaptation of Homer's second epic, that talks about Ulysses' efforts to return to his home after the end of ten years of war.

11.name: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
11.description: In 1850 Oregon, when a backwoodsman brings a wife home to his farm, his six brothers decide that they want to get married too.

12.name: The Caine Mutiny
12.description: When a U.S. Naval captain shows signs of mental instability that jeopardizes the ship, the first officer relieves him of command and faces court martial for mutiny.

13.name: Creature from the Black Lagoon
13.description: A strange prehistoric beast lurks in the depths of the Amazonian jungle. A group of scientists try to capture the animal and bring it back to civilization for study.

14.name: Child's Play
14.description: A science-fiction film about children who manage to split the atom and thereby create a new form of popcorn.

15.name: Executive Suite
15.description: When the head of a large manufacturing firm dies suddenly from a stroke, his vice presidents vie to see who will replace him.

16.name: La Strada
16.description: A care-free girl is sold to a traveling entertainer, consequently enduring physical and emotional pain along the way.

17.name: Désirée
17.description: The rise and fall of Napoleon Bonaparte, Emperor of France.

18.name: Animal Farm
18.description: A successful farmyard revolution by the resident animals vs. the farmer goes horribly wrong as the victors create a new tyranny among themselves.

19.name: Gojira
19.description: American nuclear weapons testing results in the creation of a seemingly unstoppable, dinosaur-like beast.

20.name: Them!
20.description: The earliest atomic tests in New Mexico cause common ants to mutate into giant man-eating monsters that threaten civilization.

21.name: White Christmas
21.description: A successful song-and-dance team become romantically involved with a sister act and team up to save the failing Vermont inn of their former commanding general.

22.name: The Egyptian
22.description: In ancient Egypt, a poor orphan becomes a genial physician and is eventually appointed at the Pharaoh's court where he witnesses palace intrigues and learns dangerous royal secrets.

23.name: The Glenn Miller Story
23.description: Biography of bandleader Glenn Miller from his beginnings to his death over the English Channel in December 1944.

24.name: River of No Return
24.description: The titular river unites a farmer recently released from prison, his young son, and an ambitious saloon singer. In order to survive, each must be purged of anger, and each must learn to understand and care for the others.

25.name: Johnny Guitar
25.description: After helping a wounded gang member, a strong-willed female saloon owner is wrongly suspected of murder and bank robbery by a lynch mob.

26.name: Carmen Jones
26.description: Contemporary version of the Bizet opera, with new lyrics and an African-American cast.

27.name: Brigadoon
27.description: Two Americans on a hunting trip in Scotland become lost. They encounter a small village, not on the map, called Brigadoon, in which people harbor a mysterious secret, and behave as if they were still living two hundred years in the past.

28.name: The Country Girl
28.description: A director hires an alcoholic has-been and strikes up a stormy relationship with the actor's wife, who he believes is the cause of all the man's problems.

29.name: The High and the Mighty
29.description: When a commercial airliner develops engine problems on a trans-Pacific flight and the pilot loses his nerve, it is up to the washed-up co-pilot Dan Roman to bring the plane in safely.

30.name: Vera Cruz
30.description: During the Mexican Rebellion of 1866, an unsavory group of American adventurers are hired by the forces of Emporer Maximilian to escort a countess to Vera Cruz.

31.name: The Barefoot Contessa
31.description: At Maria Vargas' funeral, several people recall who she was and the impact she had on them. Harry Dawes was a not very successful writer/director when he and movie producer Kirk Edwards ...                See full summary »

32.name: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
32.description: Set during the Korean War, a Navy fighter pilot must come to terms with with his own ambivalence towards the war and the fear of having to bomb a set of highly defended bridges. The ending of this grim war drama is all tension.

33.name: The Far Country
33.description: A self-minded adventurer (Jeff Webster) locks horns with a crooked lawman (Mr. Gannon) while driving cattle to Dawson.

34.name: Sanshô dayû
34.description: In medieval Japan, a compassionate governor is sent into exile. His wife and children try to join him, but are separated, and the children grow up amid suffering and oppression.

35.name: Hobson's Choice
35.description: Henry Hobson (Charles Laughton) is a successful bootmaker, a widower and a tyrannical father of three daughters. The girls each want to leave their father by getting married, but Henry refuses because marriage traditions require him to pay out settlements.

36.name: Riding Shotgun
36.description: When a stagecoach guard tries to warn a town of an imminent raid by a band of outlaws, the people mistake him for one of the gang

37.name: Witness to Murder
37.description: A woman's sanity comes into question, after she claims to have witnessed a murder from her apartment window.

38.name: The Silver Chalice
38.description: Paul Newman - in his screen debut - plays a 1st century Greek sculptor who is sold into slavery.

39.name: Gog
39.description: A security agent investigates sabotage and murder at a secret underground laboratory, home of two experimental robots.

40.name: It Should Happen to You
40.description: When a young woman with dreams of fame rents a billboard to advertise herself, her life changes overnight.

41.name: Viaggio in Italia
41.description: An unhappily married couple attempts to find direction and insight while vacationing in Naples.

42.name: Hell's Half Acre
42.description: An American woman goes to Hawaii to search for her husband, MIA since the war, but he's a fugitive from the law and involved in a private feud against his former crime syndicate partners.

43.name: Black Widow
43.description: A young writer insinuates herself into the life of a Broadway producer.

44.name: Forbidden Cargo
44.description: Inspector Michael Kenyon (Nigel Patrick) is a Narcotics Agent who, with the aid of a titled bird-watcher attempts to trap a brother and sister drug smuggling team.

45.name: Demetrius and the Gladiators
45.description: In 1st century Rome, Christian slave Demetrius is sent to fight in the gladiatorial arena and Emperor Caligula seeks Jesus' robe for its supposedly magical powers.

46.name: Pushover
46.description: Undercover cop falls for the beautiful moll of a bank robber on the run and together they double-cross the hood and the cops.

47.name: An Inspector Calls
47.description: When a young girl is found dead an inspector is sent to investigate a prosperous Yorkshire household. It emerges that each member of the family has a guilty secret - each one is partly responsible for her death.

48.name: I kongens klæ'r
48.description: In the company Petersen Petersen and Petersen A / S, warehouse manager Jensen discovers hidden drugs in a shipment from Müller in Hamburg.

49.name: Young at Heart
49.description: The lives and romances of three sisters in a musical family; the youngest daughter's life is complicated by the subsequent arrival of a charming composer and a cynical music arranger.

50.name: The Long, Long Trailer
50.description: Nicky and Tacy are going to be married. Nicky wants to save up money for a house, but Tacy dreams of starting off with their own home on wheels--a trailer.
